results.title: The Honeymoon
results.creator_credit: Laurel Whitcroft (Allen) and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. A family album of the holidays in the Victorian Alps taken initially by Laurel and her husband for their honeymoon, then the subsequent returns by the growing family throughout the decades.
results.description: My family has a tradition of holidaying at Mt Buffalo Chalet, that has continued through four generations. results.title: Home in the high country
results.creator_credit: Trevor Larner and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: Trevor Larner first discovered the Victorian high country as a teenager. He initially wanted to get to the highest point, but then fell in love with the vegetation and beauty of the Alpine region. Eventually he started working there maintaining infrastructure, building ski lodges and repairing the huts of the early pioneers. When Trevor went back to visit in 2008, it felt like he was coming home.

results.title: The Dulugar
results.creator_credit: James Hackell and ACMI Digital Storytelling
results.brief_description: My love of stories and my love of the bush grew at the same time. Stories bring the land to life. A story about a man’s connection to his Indigenous ancestors through the Victorian Alpine country and the stories that would pass through the generations, especially the one about the Dulugar, a fierce creature said to exist in the region, haunting campers with their red eyes and devil-like smell.

results.title: Visibility and protective clothing
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycling”
Examines the problems many motorists have in seeing motorcyclists, due to poor visibility from cars. Demonstrates the importance of protective clothing, the selection of the correct helmet, footgear, and gloves. Some riders talk about their accidents and injuries they have received.

results.title: The Ultimate skills
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Timothy Read, Peter Johnson and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Three motor cycle champions, Warren Willing, road riding, Mick Andrews, trials riding, and Trevor Flood, motor cross, explain and demonstrate their skills and techniques. Commentary by Peter Gwynne.

results.title: An Introduction to motor cycling
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Inexperience, unpreparedness, and a powerful machine, are al1 factors which cause motor cycle accidents, and contribute to an awful and unnecessary waste. Points out the different types of motor cycles appropriate to different individuals, purposes and situations, as well as explaining how a motor cycle works.

results.title: Defensive riding techniques
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Defensive riding is avoiding accidents by foreseeing possible dangers and taking appropriate action. Gives three short rules: firstly, try to anticipate and, therefore, avoid mistakes of other motorists; secondly, drive defensively, and heed all traffic rules and signals; thirdly, make sure you can be seen at all times.

results.title: Basic riding techniques
results.creator_credit: Tony Hansen, Peter Johnson, Timothy Read and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Motorcycle safety”.
Peter Wherrett and Jenny Johnson discuss why a learner should begin on a 250cc bike. Looks at instruments and controls and explains their application and proper usage. Recommends the best clothing and gear to wear for comfort and safety.
